website_summaries.verdict: While this snow shovel is worth considering if you don't anticipate a lot of snow accumulation, it comes with some durability concerns.
pros: Classic snow shovel design with a slightly curved blade that doubles as a pusher
Has a galvanized steel strip on the blade
cons: Scoop is plastic, and has been reported to crack after repeated use
Handle isn't very sturdy, and may not hold up to heavy snow

customer_reviews.title: now totally useless. Suncast
customer_reviews.text: Original review (one star): This shovel did not survive two seasons, leaving me stranded during the only real storm of the year. The blade fell apart at the joint with the handle, now totally useless. Suncast, if you're listening, I'll give you a chance to replace or refund this item. Otherwise, my review stands. Update: They sent me a new shovel after some run around with customer service. I will give them another star.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: It's a shovel...it moves snow
customer_reviews.text: I received this the day before we got some snow. I have a 30 foot wide 45 foot long concrete driveway. I got this for less than 2 inches of snow (more than that, I get the snow blower out). It works as advertised. I push snow, not lift it, and this does the job. I do like the steel blade, but haven't tried it on ice, but it did work just fine on car tire compacted snow. After the third use, some snow did start sticking to the shovel. I sprayed it with PAM and I'm sure that won't be a problem again.
customer_reviews.author: RoginOhio

customer_reviews.title: WORKS AMAZING WELL AND HOLDS UP TO NASTY WEATHER!
customer_reviews.text: I'M A WOMAN FROM THE NORTHEAST AND WOULD HAVE POO-POOED THE USE OF A PLASTIC SHOVEL IF I HADN'T MOVED TO COLORADO. (I'VE DONE A LOT OF SHOVELING!) FOR THE MOST PART WE DON'T HAVE THE FREEZING RAIN AND ICY SNOW THAT IS FOUND IN MASSACHUSETTS. THIS SHOVEL IS WELL CONSTRUCTED AND NOT CHEAP PLASTIC. I'VE USED IT FOR ABOUT 5 SNOWSTORM CLEANUPS NOW AND IT WORKS VERY WELL. IT DOES HAVE A METAL EDGE TO HELP OUT WHEN THINGS GET MESSY AND IT STILL LOOKS BRAND NEW! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Dovetail

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately this shovel didn't hold up very well for me ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this shovel didn't hold up very well for me. Sometimes we get heavy snow in Michigan - and this shovel worked for a few months, but ended up bending in the middle - see picture attached.
customer_reviews.author: JPL

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made and not fit for the purpose
customer_reviews.text: This is flimsy. So what that it has a metal strip, which one reviewer claims works on ice. The shovel is so flimsy that it just buckles. Find a metal shovel. Not easy to find. I'm sending this back and I'm going to keep looking. Plastic works for light fluffy snow and some other situations. However, for anything that is a little more difficult, plastic is plain JUNK. Just say no to plastic for this product! See the shaft of the handle in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brehob

customer_reviews.title: My newest winter weapon
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my second Suncast shovel, replacing an old reliable, but wood-handled, snow thrower. The first Suncast is still in use here in Idaho, and it promises to be my newest old and reliable thrower. The galvanized reinforced front edge still has not loosened, and although the hard plastic scoop worries me sometimes in the -15F cold, I've not seen a crack in 6 years -- nor heard an ominous creak. I prefer the straight handle to get a better angle when scraping snow that was packed by my car tires on the driveway. Everything is right about this shovel, including the price and delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Essais

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight snow shovel!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to use in shoveling 8" of snow!! Some snow shovels have too large or too curved a basket, making it difficult to scoop or push snow off walkways and driveways. This shovel is perfect as both a pusher and scooper, and the reinforced metal blade helps scrape icy areas easily. Very happy with this purchase and looking forward to using it in our future snowfalls!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: light shovel that does heavy work
customer_reviews.text: Tough shovel. Been through two tough winters with this shovel now and it's been great. Long handle, strong shovel, light weight, and the curved bottom makes for lifting a lot of snow with each scoop. Used in heavy snow, used in light snow, used to make snow igloos, and used to clear the driveway. Even used the metal blade at the bottom to chip and shovel away the ice (I know I'm probably not supposed to).
customer_reviews.author: Likes to eat Pi

customer_reviews.title: Bought two more this year because unfortunaly somebody else liked my shovels and stole them
customer_reviews.text: Never had a problem with Suncast snow shovels. Find them to be built well and last awhile. Bought two more this year because unfortunaly somebody else liked my shovels and stole them. My only complaint about these is they are great for smaller jobs like sidewalks but would not buy this for a driveway if these are your only source of shoveling. Find that the do not hold a lot of snow.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson

customer_reviews.title: I found this shovel to not be quite right for ...
customer_reviews.text: I found this shovel to not be quite right for the job I needed. I bet it would work well on a smooth asphalt driveway with a few inches of snow. But when I used it on a wooden deck and gravel driveway I found that it tended to catch on any uneven surface. It feels a bit flimsy but it didn't break so it may be stronger than it looks.
customer_reviews.author: E Thorn

customer_reviews.title: and I like them better than another model we had last year ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these snow shovels, and I like them better than another model we had last year that ended up breaking. We live in Northern Virginia and had a blizzard in January with 30 inches of accumulation. These snow shovels did well, and did not break under the weight of the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Amberly

customer_reviews.title: Great Shovel on Pavement for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at the end of last winter and just used it for the first time now. It works great. I missed that it has a metal guard, which I didn't want because that's not something I can use on my deck, but we need multiple shovels anyway and this is perfect for the driveway as well as OK for the frickin' slate walkway, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K

customer_reviews.title: Good Shovel For the Money
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad shovel. Typical construction found in today's products. By that I mean the plastic shovel end is not super rigid like shovels 10 plus years ago. The metal strip will eventually bend on the ends and get all chewed up. However we had one bad storm of 8-10 inches and the snow was wet snow and it did the job where needed when the snow blower wasn't an option. So for the money the shovel is worth it. Maybe in a climate like Buffalo, NY you may want to spend more but the typical user should get a few years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: VMega

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I had this same shovel that i bought years ago and it's still going but cracking. I have used many different kinds of shovels but this one is my personal favorite. It lasted for years of snow and ice. This replacement is the exact same one. The handle will bend if you try to lift too much ice or real wet heavy snow so don't over do it. This will last years and get the job done. It is well built for a light shovel.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: This is a plastic shovel
customer_reviews.text: This was advertised as a metal shovel. However, the only metal on it is a tiny strip on the end. Plastic shovels just wont cut it for me.
customer_reviews.author: B Wkmn

customer_reviews.title: Best ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best snow shovel I have ever used. I am 68, so I need a shovel that is easy to use. This one is. The last snowfall was a heavy wet snow. I was able to push the snow instead of lifting. The snow did not stick to the shovel. The handle gives me more control. My previous shovels twisted too easily with a load of snow. Glad I ordered this snow shovel.
customer_reviews.author: P. Troutman

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for a native Buffalo man.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as Christmas gift for husband. Live in the south where we get snow every 3-4 years. He is from Buffalo and complained a plain shovel was not doing the job on the driveway(which is really long). Anyway, he absolutely was thrilled to get this for our next snow!!
customer_reviews.author: jangie

customer_reviews.title: It worked like all snow shovels should but don't.
customer_reviews.text: Last winter was not the ultimate Syracuse winter. Only about 120 inches. So the shovel didn't get a real workout. But I was pleased that it carried snow from the sidewalk to the yard, the scoop part didn't crack, the snow didn't stick to it, and it fit in the back of my SUV. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Martha W. Bonney

customer_reviews.title: not always what you order.
customer_reviews.text: first one looked as advertised but it broke midway through the first season (see crack in the middle of left green shovel). so I got a second one. the second did not come with a wear strip or even looks the same. hopefully gets me through the rest of the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Moreau

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this shovel just in time for our big snow. It's well made, and light. However, the snow sticks to the plastic a bit (going to have to spray it), and the metal edge is so sharp it catches on everything when I'm shoveling. So if you have an uneven surface, this shovel's edge might be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: A. MAC

customer_reviews.title: A must have shovel that beats all!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Update: So it’s now January of 2018 after that ridiculous northeaster blizzard bombogenesis and out comes my “3 year old” and it’s still the best shovel EVER. Cleared over 2-3 feet of drifts down to pavement and this after 3 winters and no back ache. Best Best Best shovel ever! This is by far the best shovel I have ever owned. Light weight, easy to push or lift and the blade is so firm and sharp it makes clearing ice a breeze. Plan to buy a back up out of fear they'll change it. Get this shovel. It's simply the best!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Romeyd

customer_reviews.title: It's a shovel and works like a shovel should...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this shovel for two heavy snowfalls and it has performed fairly well. The snow easily slides into the shovel and fills the entire shovel. However, not all the snow empties when I seek to empty the shovel. The wetter the snow, the more snow stayed in the shovel. This is a problem, I have had with other shovels and am not sure that it is possible to have a shovel where this does not occur. So far so good and glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Biased Perspective

customer_reviews.title: Solid Construction fo Heavy Duty Use
customer_reviews.text: Exceptionally well made item. It even arrived on the day of the first snow of the year so it was useful right out of the box. Light weight but incredibly strong, even my wife was able to use it with ease. I highly recommend it and the seller for top quality products.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wascher

customer_reviews.title: Big Snow Shovel!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great snow shovel! I have used this one for a couple of winters in OKC and just store it in the backseat of my truck during the winter. It is BIG and moves a lot of snow quickly! It has dug my truck out a few times and it does it fast. The long handle and large scoop make easy work of most snow shoveling jobs. And the metal wear strip gets the snow off of concrete walks cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Snow Shovel/Pusher Combo
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these Snow Shovel/Pusher Combos. I am more than satisfied with them. Found them easy to either shovel or push the snow and I am 74 years old. They are made very sturdy and don't seem to add much weight to the shovel full. There is a sharp blade that cuts through the snow and ice. I would recommend this to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Took heavy wet snow great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this late in the Summer to be ready for Winter. Best investment of the year. We have had every kind of snow over this Winter from light to wet, loose and compact. It took zero damage. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes you right down to pavement with ease.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shovel for living in New England. I do feel a slight give when shoveling the sloppiest of the wet snow, but know your limits and it will do fine. For the light and fluffy stuff - this takes you right down to pavement with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Dan A.

customer_reviews.title: Great!  Loved the Hybrid design.
customer_reviews.text: I got this shovel used, and it was still great even used! It had a couple of scratches on it, but it was in wonderful shape and worked great! I love the hybrid design so I can use it as a push, or I can use it as a typical shovel.
customer_reviews.author: B. Morrow

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Have not had the opportunity to utilize this piece of gear. However, based on percieved durability it should perform as one would expect of a snow shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great shovel for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great shovel for the price, has a little metal blade on front to help break up some light ice or heavy blocks of snow. Large overall size and depth to throw snow over your shoulder to get it out of your path.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Singer

customer_reviews.title: Atwood
customer_reviews.text: Friend need one and she doesn't drive anymore so it was the fastest way to get one to her. I live in New Jersey she live in Kansas a fly over state.
customer_reviews.author: Atwood

customer_reviews.title: It shovels snow adequately
customer_reviews.text: It does the job just fine. I don't really know what else to say but I think the price was pretty good and quality just as nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A.

customer_reviews.title: durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exact model several years ago and has lasted well except the metal edge has torn off after hitting screw heads on the deck after years of work.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T. Huss

customer_reviews.title: Nice Snow Shovel for a Southerner
customer_reviews.text: This shovel work great for the occasional snow we have down in North Carolina. It is solidly constructed and properly weighted. I worry a bit about the metal piece running along the bottom rusting, but it'll be fine for us.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Fairly effective
customer_reviews.text: This year's winter has been pretty brutal in the northeast, so we ordered this shovel for our new house because it has a longer driveway and we needed a bigger shovel. It's a pretty good one and we got a decent price, I just wish it was a little bit sturdier. The plastic scoop is somewhat bendy (maybe 5-10% give) so I think we're going to have to be careful if there is packed ice from the snow plows that push past the end of the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy snow shovel
customer_reviews.text: This works great, and doesn't look as beat up as I thought it would by now. It's shoveled a lot of snow and probably more ice than what it's meant to. I just wish it was more ergonomically friendly; I'll have to look for a different kind for the more serious shoveling next winter. My back is killing me after a big snow and working on the driveway. It probably saves me a trip to the gym though.
customer_reviews.author: Modern Art Snob

customer_reviews.title: Though it was sturdy, I did return it as it takes too ...
customer_reviews.text: the shovel was larger and bulkier than expcted. Though it was sturdy, I did return it as it takes too much space to keep in the trunk during a snowstorm.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Not happy that I have to shovel snow, but it works well and is quite sturdy. No problems
customer_reviews.author: Genes

customer_reviews.title: No Galvanized Steel Wear Strip as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The description includes "Galvanized Steel Wear Strip", which is also pictured in the image. Ordered two with that feature specifically in mind. No Galvanized Steel Wear Strip on either one. BIG RIP OFF. Not worth the time and effort to return something this big and cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shovel for our area. We had record snowfall this year and this shovel did the trick. It is light weight and easy to maneuver across our good sized driveway. The metal wear strip helps but I can tell it will probably only last a few seasons but given the low price, I wont mind buying a new one every few years.
customer_reviews.author: Fixerman

customer_reviews.title: Cracked when trying to shovel some icy snow.
customer_reviews.text: Cracked when trying to shovel some icy snow. Other plastic shovels I've owned have cracked on similar snow. That's a plastic tool for you. I wish they'd use a flexier type of plastic so this would be a thing of the past.
customer_reviews.author: freddy binary

customer_reviews.title: It Is Surprisingly Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I wish it could actually do the shuffling for you but it really is surprisingly sturdy and makes the job easier.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Shovel has worked well the two times it’s snowed since I got it. It really is a good hybrid between pushing and picking up.
customer_reviews.author: Belle

customer_reviews.title: No snow here...but...
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer stated, there isn't snow in Florida. True, but being from Indiana, I know what a good snow shovel can do. We have camphor trees surrounding our house and have a huge amount of leaves to scoop up. This shovel works great! I use it to push and scoop up the leaves that are in the road as well as to scoop up the leaves after I rake or blow the yard. Makes the job so much easier. This seems to be a pretty sturdy shovel. I wasn't sure I would like a plastic one as I've always had aluminum so we'll see how many years it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: RCH

customer_reviews.title: Nice shovel
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is great. Please know that it is a bit small. Probably too small for a male. Works well for Wisconsin weather.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong and effective
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to break up a bunch of ice on my driveway. I'm not very strong, but I can hit the ice chunks as hard as possible without denting the shovel. The sharp corner on it is quite effective at breaking up some big ice blocks under the snow. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: KatieL

customer_reviews.title: Looks very nice. No snow since I purchased
customer_reviews.text: Looks very nice. No snow since I purchased, but looks like it will work well. Will update post when used;
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this shovel
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy shovel. I live in a snow zone and I used this so much I bought a second one. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waist your money.
customer_reviews.text: This must be designed by someone in Hawaii or someplace with absolutely no snow. The handle has about much substance as a twisty straw, the rest follows suit.
customer_reviews.author: llaferte

customer_reviews.title: SOUTH DAKOTA TESTED
customer_reviews.text: Have this on the back deck, so I can keep a clear path for my dog. Easy to use on the deck steps and just the right size for a 12" path.
customer_reviews.author: jmattie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality snow shovel.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality snow shovel. Nice blend between pusher and scoop, only had a few dustings so far will see how it holds up long term.
customer_reviews.author: Gebirgsman

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, I use it to help me pick up leaves in spring time
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Ragland

customer_reviews.title: It shovels, but you might get a little frustrated every time you hit solid ground
customer_reviews.text: sharp blade causes the shovel to stop forcing you to use more effort than necessary. Handle feels short too.
customer_reviews.author: stompyd

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: I live in the south, don’t get much snow. The one time it snowed last year this was pretty worthless. It didn’t do a good job at getting under the snow
customer_reviews.author: Tony T

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: It was not a suncast and wasn't green and didn't have the metal strip. I am very unhappy. To much work to return it so will put it in the church rummage sale. As you can see I have ordered a different model. Hopefully I will get the one I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Moriarty

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's a shovel. Made well & does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy~

customer_reviews.title: Nice shovel
customer_reviews.text: Nice shovel but there's a bend in the handle, I hope it is able to hold up for the next snow!
customer_reviews.author: Kait

customer_reviews.title: another quality Suncast product
customer_reviews.text: quality construction of the handle, shovel, and most importantly the metal "ice" strip on the bottom of the shovel. keep an eye on changing prices throughout the year and make an educated purchase with this item!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Handy dandy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy dandy snow shovel. We have two niw, one at home and one at my mom's. Also works great as a long-handled dust pan for sweeping up Spring seeds and blooms from trees!
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: The shovel is fine. It's a shovel. But the handle does not stay attached. You better have a drill and a small screw handy if you buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Whaler

customer_reviews.title: Had to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Shovel works great, this is the second one I ordered. The first one came assembled as shown in the photo, the one I just received had to be screwed together (the hand grip to the handle and the handle to the shovel), which is why I took off 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Alan C

customer_reviews.title: So, we got 9" of snow in Atlanta. ...
customer_reviews.text: So, we got 9" of snow in Atlanta. I'm guessing I'm the only one around here who now has a snow shovel! LOL!
customer_reviews.author: gp134

customer_reviews.title: Good quality shovel that doesn't weigh too much
customer_reviews.text: This shovel has been going through one of the toughest winters I've been though in a long time. It's slightly smaller than my other shovel which must be a 21 inch shovel. My wife prefers this one because it's a little smaller so she isn't trying to lift as much weight as should would be with the larger 21 inch shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Bacon Jonnie's

customer_reviews.title: Helped a lot this winter.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this shove, it is strong and easy to handle. It is able to cut up ice also with a little force. The only problem I had with it, is wet snow will stick to it. Easy way to prevent that is spray some cooking spray and no more sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact snow shovel!
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact snow shovel! Great for cleaning up stairs, porches, and other smaller places. My wife finds it easier to handle than the bigger ones.
customer_reviews.author: Royal

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this thing twice to do a fairly modest amount of snow showering and the head is already loose and wobbly. Hard to imagine it will hold up to more than another 2 or 3 uses. Not worth the savings I'm going to end up buying a sturdier shovel anyway
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would like something that didn't make me bend over so far
customer_reviews.text: I mean, it's a shovel. I had to wait to review this until I actually used it. It certainly shovels. I'm 5'6" and this actually feels a little short for me. I would like something that didn't make me bend over so far. Also my back is just crappy :-(
customer_reviews.author: JinDenver

customer_reviews.title: It shovels snow!
customer_reviews.text: Yep. It's a snow shovel. Works just fine. Seems to be good quality. Its good for pushing or throwing the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Ness

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time using it. Don't waist your money ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke first time using it. Don't waist your money the plastic is brittle and it didn't even get two pushes of snow cleared. I'll never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: chasse

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built. A word caution for taller people though ...
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built. A word caution for taller people though: this shovel is noticibly shorter than what I'm used to: my other shovels are 4-5 inches taller.
customer_reviews.author: seth

customer_reviews.title: Don't miss this one!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the money, if only it came with an operator!
customer_reviews.author: Sally/Tom

customer_reviews.title: Nice shovel
customer_reviews.text: Shipped here only wrapped in see-through plastic wrap, but that was enough to protect it. Handle is a bit longer than my 15-year-old shovel so this will take some getting used to. However, it is light weight yet sturdy. Luckily I've not gotten to try it out yet (no more snow!) so I can't report on whether or not I like how it performs with actual snow.
customer_reviews.author: Chudwad1

customer_reviews.title: This is a great shovel. I have also used it for shoveling ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shovel. I have also used it for shoveling not related to snow (mulch, wood chips) and it really was useful.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Why would you buy a snow shovel online?
customer_reviews.text: A couple of years ago we had a freak snow storm before the area merchants had stocked winter gear. After visiting 3 stores, I gave up and bought online. It was nice because I was a snow-shovel noobie and I could look at the features and reviews from veterans. Since purchasing this awesome shovel, it has worked as insurance, as we have not had enough snow to need it. This one is nice... not too big to lift when full.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Young

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a few years now, broke my other shovel but this one still holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Crimson

customer_reviews.title: Held together by one measly screw that broke the first ...
customer_reviews.text: Held together by one measly screw that broke the first day I used it. It’s for light dry snow only. Can’t handle torque at all.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lighter option for clearing the driveway and this fit the bill. The snow is heavy enough without adding a 15# shovel to the mix, so this shovel is perfect. Strong enough to break though thick/icy snow, light enough not to break my back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: do not buy this shovel
customer_reviews.text: I used this shovel less than 2 minutes and the handle broke. poor quality
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne  E. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Strong and lightweight !
customer_reviews.text: Great shovel. This is the best shovel I've found so far. Good price also.
customer_reviews.author: Fortis Arma

customer_reviews.title: Great Shovel for Southern Snows
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is amazing for the price. It did an amazing job getting through the ice on the bottom of the snow. Would highly recommend this for smaller driveways.
customer_reviews.author: Josh D.

customer_reviews.title: Feels great in the hands but metal edge could be harder
customer_reviews.text: Used it only once and the metal edge on it already bent some so I guess the metal isn't as strong as my other two shovels. Otherwise I like the design and the feel of it.
customer_reviews.author: hailx4

customer_reviews.title: Love this shovel
customer_reviews.text: Love this shovel,, I’m small and just what I needed,, it’ll push the snow if it isn’t to deep,, 5 Stars
customer_reviews.author: mary r. perkins

customer_reviews.title: Arrived a day before a Winter Storm and gets put to good use!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the shovel via Amazon Prime to arrive a day before a winter storm was forecast to impact my area. It arrived on time fully assembled and ready to go. It was put to good use a day later as several inches of snow fell. It did a great job for not a huge cost. I definitely recommend this shovel!
customer_reviews.author: David Reimer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy snow shovel
customer_reviews.text: A nice sturdy shovel. Lightweight. It does not have an ergonomic handle for folks with back issues.
customer_reviews.author: Janice C

customer_reviews.title: I snowed again after I got it and it works great.
customer_reviews.text: I Ordered this because we were expecting snow, but it was delivered late because of the weather. I snowed again after I got it and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Who needs a Snow Shovel in GA? This guy! And this works nice
customer_reviews.author: Jay Cee Ess

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love the lightweight and the steel piece on the end for breaking up ice chunks
customer_reviews.author: bcschoen

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is the bomb! It has a metal edge and gets right down to the cement.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn S. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great product but heavy
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is really big and heavy. I haven’t used it yet but Winter is not over yet.
customer_reviews.author: Anne-Marie Stanley

customer_reviews.title: ... of heavy wet snow and breaks through ice fairly easy.
customer_reviews.text: Use this past winter moves a lot of heavy wet snow and breaks through ice fairly easy.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: A good snow shovel
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY bad thing about the shovel{that I can think of} is; It could be a little wider. Or maybe make 2 sizes 1-18" and 1-24" for guys who like to move alot of snow quickly. But everything about the 18" shovel is great. Built tough and the length is perfect for me and I'm 5ft 10in. So far-so good and we've had our share of snow so far.
customer_reviews.author: Marty V

customer_reviews.title: Do not use in heavy wet snow
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for almost all snow types and depths but it will buckle if you lift water-logged snow with it.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: looks fine.
customer_reviews.text: A very picky friend from Minnesota said “good shovel.” Does the job, looks fine.
customer_reviews.author: EagerEyes

customer_reviews.title: Love the look!
customer_reviews.text: I love the look is all I can say! I live in Georgia and I bought this a couple of years ago after we got a bad snow storm and we were in need of a shovel. Of course because I have it it has yet to snow again here! Doesn't always work that way?! It looks great hanging in my garage but I have yet to see how well it works!
customer_reviews.author: Marie323

customer_reviews.title: Need another!
customer_reviews.text: Study! Lasted all through our snow days and still like new. Thank you for now breaking on us! Buying another for husband and I to be out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good for 1 season.
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of thinking metal beats ice. Now there is no metal and some ice. Good for snow and loose dirt, nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: ilosh wdgac

customer_reviews.title: Great Shovel!!
customer_reviews.text: This product came as described with the wear strip and everything, i'm not sure what happened with the 1 star poster but i got exactly what i ordered and it works great. I was easily able to shovel my driveway and even push some ice under the snow. Great product for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Jess Ann

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, light, and easy to lift and is also a good pusher.
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Mac Donald

customer_reviews.title: It shovels snow
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the wear strip on the bottom edge. It
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: Works good , light weight so it is easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: DiDi

product_meta.title: Suncast SC1350 18-Inch Snow Shovel/Pusher Combo with Wear Strip, Green
product_meta.description: Remove snow more easily with the versatile Suncast 18 in. (width of blade) Bent Handle Snow Shovel. The deep blade and angled rib pattern allow you to both shovel and push snow with just one tool. The handle design helps give less strain on your back when shoveling. It offers comfortability and reliability. This allows more for efficient shoveling saving you time. It includes a galvanized steel wear strip. Use this shovel all around whether its on a sidewalk or in your driveway. The winter season can bring a ton of snow with it; show you are ready with the Suncast Snow Shovel/Pusher.
feature_bullets: DURABLE: Steel handle with galvanized steel wear strip
ERGONOMIC: Handle for comfort and repeated use
LONG-LASTING: Coated plastic 18 in. blade width
EASY TO USE: Angled rib pattern makes the job go quickly. Perfect for shoveling your driveway, walkways, and sidewalks

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars352 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
